DOCNAME: CASE OF PAPAMICHALOPOULOS AND OTHERS v. GREECE
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection dismissed (Art. 35) Admissibility criteria;(Art. 35-1) Exhaustion of domestic remedies;Preliminary objection dismissed (Art. 34) Individual applications;(Art. 34) Victim;Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions);Just satisfaction reserved (Article 41 - Just satisfaction)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , who are all of NORP nationality , are the owners or co - owners of land in the area of GPE , near GPE , GPE . On DATE ORG gave its consent for the construction of a hotel complex on the site . At the applicants’ request , an NORP firm of architects drew up plans .

CARDINAL . By a Law of DATE ( anagastikos nomos no . CARDINAL - " Law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL " ) , which was passed DATE after the dictatorship was established , ORG transferred an area of QUANTITY . m near LOC beach to ORG ( PERSON ) .
CARDINAL of the applicants , who owned part of this land ( QUANTITY . m ) , applied to ORG at ORG ) , requesting him to take interim measures and " restore the original position " .

On DATE ORG made CARDINAL orders granting the applications , as the land in question was not public forest but consisted of agricultural land cultivated by the owners . CARDINAL of the CARDINAL orders , however , was revoked by ORG at ORG on the ground of " lack of urgency " , following an application by ORG .

On DATE the Minister of Agriculture informed ORG headquarters that part of the land transferred was not available for disposal and that it was necessary to take steps to " restore the rightful position " .

CARDINAL . Far from restoring the land to its owners , however , the ORG proceeded to construct a naval base and a holiday resort for officers . A royal decree of CARDINAL DATE ( published in ORG of DATE ) designated the entire LOC region as a " naval fortress " .

CARDINAL . After DATE of the dictatorship in DATE , PERSON , the father of the applicants PERSON and ORG , commenced proceedings in ORG to establish his title to CARDINAL parcels of land . In a judgment ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) given on DATE the court held that in DATE the plaintiff had indeed acquired title to QUANTITY . m of land by a notarially recorded deed ; that the land in question was not public forest but consisted of parcels which had been cultivated and occupied bona fide by various individuals successively since DATE ; and that ORG was therefore obliged to return it .

CARDINAL . ORG upheld this decision on DATE ( in judgment no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) . It considered that the ORG had not transferred ownership of the land in question in DATE since it had no title and the presumption of ownership applied only to forests , not to agricultural land .

CARDINAL . An appeal on points of law by ORG was dismissed by ORG ( PERSON ) on DATE ( in judgment no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , on the ground that Mr PERSON ascendants had acquired title to their land by prescription and in accordance with ORG law applicable at the time ( DATE ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON sent a bailiff to serve the above - mentioned judgments on ORG with a view to their enforcement . On DATE , accompanied by a bailiff , he went to the entrance of the naval base and sought enforcement of the court decisions , but the commanding officer of the base refused to admit them on the grounds that he had been ordered not to and that they required authorisation from ORG headquarters , which was refused . An application to ORG at ORG was also unsuccessful .
CARDINAL . In DATE PERSON and the other applicants brought CARDINAL actions in ORG to establish their title to the land in issue . The ORG intervened in the proceedings in support of ORG .

In CARDINAL interlocutory decisions of DATE ( CARDINAL . DATE and CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) the court ordered further inquiries into the facts . It also held it necessary to commission several experts to examine the title documents in the applicants’ and ORG possession and file an opinion within DATE on whether the land belonged to the plaintiffs or was part of the public forest transferred by PERSON no . DATE . However , the proceedings remained pending .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Minister of Defence informed the applicants that the construction of the naval base prevented return of the land in question , but that proceedings were under way with a view to a grant of other plots of land to replace those occupied by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Minister of Agriculture requested the Prefect of GPE to transfer to the applicants land of equal value situated in that region . He stated that even though the court decisions delivered so far related to only some of the private individuals who had been dispossessed in DATE , future or pending actions brought by other owners would certainly have the same outcome .

Notwithstanding a decree of DATE regulating building development within the " Ramnoudos " archaeological site in the PERSON valley ( in which the disputed land was situated ) , ORG carried on with the construction of a hotel complex within the perimeter of the naval base .

CARDINAL . By a joint decision of CARDINAL DATE the Minister for ORG and ORG set up a committee of experts to choose certain of the pieces of land offered in exchange by ORG and value them ; among these was a plot at PERSON in GPE ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . The committee expressed its findings in a report of DATE .

CARDINAL . In section CARDINAL ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) of PERSON no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , published in ORG of DATE , it was expressly acknowledged that private individuals who were claiming title to land occupied by ORG were entitled to apply for other land in exchange , using the procedure laid down in LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) ; for this purpose it provided for a procedure for verifying title to the land in accordance with LAW of that code .
The explanatory memorandum on the PERSON contained the following :
" [ S]ection [ CARDINAL ] provides for the possibility of settling the case of the properties included in the area ... transferred to ORG under LAW . CARDINAL/CARDINAL .

This is an area of QUANTITY . m. It is claimed by a number of private individuals . Some of these have brought actions in the civil courts and obtained from ORG a final decision in which they are acknowledged to be the owners . Having regard to the fact that the other [ pending ] cases are likely to have the same outcome and that paying compensation would be a solution disadvantageous to the authorities , an enactment must be passed enabling [ the remaining private individuals ] to replace their properties by others , which belong to the ORG and are available , subject to prior verification of the ORG title .

CARDINAL . Under this PERSON the applicants applied to ORG ( Epitropi apallotrioseon ) , composed of the President of ORG and civil - service experts . In decision no . DATE the ORG acknowledged their ownership of an area of CARDINAL sq . m. It stated the following :

" ... it appears from the hearings , written submissions , oral statements and documents in the case file that the applicants ... occupied bona fide in continuous and regular fashion from time immemorial until DATE an area of approximately [ QUANTITY . m ] situate at FAC ... ; that the aforesaid area had for a long time been used for agriculture , as shown by several items of evidence ... "
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG appealed to ORG against this decision . ORG joined it by intervening in the proceedings on DATE .

In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ( no . DATE ) ORG declared the appeal inadmissible ; in the court ’s opinion , only the ORG and the parties concerned had standing to appeal against the decision in question , and not third parties such as ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld this decision .
CARDINAL . The Minister for Economic Affairs lodged an appeal on points of law , which was declared inadmissible by ORG on DATE ( in judgment no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) on the following grounds :

" ... Law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL gave third parties ... who claim ownership of the tract contained within the larger area transferred to ORG the possibility of applying for the claimed land to be exchanged for another plot of equal value ... . Such exchanges will be effected in accordance with the procedure laid down in DATE , DATE and CARDINAL of Article CARDINAL of LAW , that is to say by a decision of ORG , after administrative proceedings before a tripartite board and in accordance with LAW . ... In order to ensure that these exchanges are effected quickly and simply , the legislature has given interested parties the possibility of using the simple , quick procedure provided for in LAW in order to have their [ title ] acknowledged . In adopting the aforementioned provision of LAW no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , it did not intend to provide , in accordance with LAW , a solution for the dispute which might arise if ORG claimed against third parties the ownership of the area transferred by PERSON no . DATE . For that purpose ORG will have to use the procedure of ordinary law . This is apparent not only from the wording and the grammatical interpretation of the aforementioned provision ... but also from the purpose that the legislature sought to achieve ...

... In granting the right to have their title ... acknowledged only to the ` private ORG ( natural and legal persons ) that own [ these ] areas of land ... , the legislature did not introduce any unjustified discrimination against ORG and did not deprive it of judicial protection , as it is still open to it , under ordinary - law procedure , to secure recognition of its title , which will not , however , enable it to receive other areas of land as this was not the legislature ’s intention ... "
On DATE ( in judgment no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) ORG dismissed , on the same grounds , an appeal on points of law that had been brought by ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE a further decree extended the geographical boundaries of the " naval fortress " .

Pursuant to section CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , the Prefect of LOC informed the Minister of Agriculture and the applicants on DATE that some of the parcels of land offered in exchange were subject to special rules of ownership , while others had already been developed , and others again were protected by the legislation on forests .

In DATE the Minister of Agriculture suggested to the applicants that they should accept land in the prefecture of GPE , QUANTITY from LOC ; it asked the Prefect of PERSON to look for land for this purpose . In view of the authorities’ silence , CARDINAL Members of ORG in DATE put questions in ORG to ORG asking what action had been taken in the matter . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG admitted that it had been unable to find suitable land .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants had brought CARDINAL actions in ORG against ORG and ORG , represented by ORG , for damages for the loss of use of their property . In CARDINAL judgments of DATE the court adjourned the cases on the ground that verification of the ORG title to the land had not been completed except in the case of PERSON .

CARDINAL . Earlier , ORG had asked ORG to produce a valuation of the property in issue . The designated expert obtained from the third applicant , PERSON , the opinion of all the owners in question on the documents which ORG had communicated to him . On DATE PERSON asked ORG for information about the nature of the documents made available to the expert . On DATE the ORG refused to provide any on the ground that the matter was of the nature of an internal procedure and this ruled out any intervention by third parties .
CARDINAL . Several other actions for damages brought over a period up to DATE were adjourned by ORG or else have not yet been heard .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG wrote to ORG ( PERSON tou GPE ) asking them to find land which might be used for the proposed exchange ; it also drew their attention to the ORG ’s obligation to pay the applicants exorbitant sums of money if the exchange did not take place . In its answer ORG again stated that there was no land available .

CARDINAL . By decision no . CARDINAL of the ORG , published in ORG of CARDINAL DATE , the administrative board of ORG had transferred to ORG ownership of CARDINAL sq . m of land belonging to the disused NORP military camp at GPE , GPE , in the vicinity of the land in issue ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . This land , which was intended for sale , was included in the land register and given the name " PERSON estate " . On CARDINAL DATE ORG placed advertisements in the press .

On DATE the applicants’ lawyer wrote to ORG , asking whether it would be possible to allocate the new estate to his clients ; on DATE he sent an identical letter to all the relevant ministers , the President of ORG and ORG . The applicants have not yet received any response , apart from a copy of a letter from ORG department responsible for public property to ORG asking the latter to take action under its powers and notify the writer and the other public authorities dealing with the case .
CARDINAL . Under LAW of DATE , which applied at the time the PERSON in issue was passed ,

" CARDINAL . No one shall be deprived of his property unless it is for the public benefit , which must be duly proved , when and as specified by law and only after full compensation . Compensation shall in all cases be determined by the civil courts . In urgent cases it may also be determined by the courts on a provisional basis after the beneficiary has been heard or summoned , and the court may , at its discretion , require the latter to provide commensurate security , as provided by law . Until payment of the final or provisional compensation determined by the court , all rights of the owner shall be maintained intact and occupation of the property shall not be allowed .

CARDINAL . Special status shall govern requisitioning to meet the needs of the armed forces in the event of war or mobilisation or to meet an immediate social need that is likely to jeopardise public order or public health . "
" CARDINAL . Property shall be protected by the ORG ; rights deriving therefrom , however , may not be exercised contrary to the public interest .

CARDINAL . No one may be deprived of his property unless it is for the public benefit , which must be duly proved , when and as specified by law and only after full compensation corresponding to the value of the expropriated property at the time of the court hearing on the provisional determination of compensation . In cases in which an application is made for immediate final determination of compensation , regard shall be had to the value at the time of the court hearing of the application .
CARDINAL . Any change in the value of expropriated property occurring after publication of the expropriation decision and resulting exclusively from it shall not be taken into account .

CARDINAL . Compensation shall in all cases be determined by the civil courts . It may also be determined by the courts on a provisional basis after the beneficiary has been heard or summoned , and the court may , at its discretion , require the latter to provide commensurate security before receiving the compensation , as provided by law .
Until payment of the final or provisional compensation determined by the court , all rights of the owner shall be maintained intact and occupation of the property shall not be allowed .

The compensation awarded must be paid within DATE at the latest from the date of publication of the decision provisionally determining the compensation payable ; in the case of applications for immediate final determination of compensation , this must be paid within DATE at the latest from the date of publication of the court ruling , otherwise the expropriation shall automatically be revoked .
The compensation as such shall be exempt from all taxes , deductions and rates .

CARDINAL . The cases in which a compulsory indemnity shall be payable to the beneficiaries for loss of income from expropriated property until the time of payment of the compensation shall be laid down by law .

CARDINAL . Where works of public benefit or of general importance to the economy of the country are being carried out , a law may allow the expropriation by the ORG of areas greater than that of the land needed for the execution of the works . The same law shall lay down the conditions and terms of such expropriation , as well as the arrangements for the disposal or use for public or public - utility purposes in general of expropriated areas not required for the execution of the proposed works .
CARDINAL . Under section CARDINAL of Law no . DATE ,

" Land of which third parties have claimed ownership and which forms part of the area at FAC in GPE which was transferred to ORG under PERSON no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ... may , on application by the persons concerned , be exchanged for land of equal value , dedicated for public use ( koinokhristes ) or available under the legislation on land use , in accordance with the procedure provided for in paragraphs CARDINAL , DATE and CARDINAL of Article CARDINAL of LAW .
In order to have their ownership of the said land acknowledged , the persons concerned may follow the procedure laid down in LAW ... "
CARDINAL . The relevant paragraphs of ORG and CARDINAL of the Rural Code provide :
" Acknowledgment of title

CARDINAL . Where an application is made to it by the parties concerned , the appropriate ORG shall determine title to the expropriated land in accordance with Law no . CARDINAL and Article CARDINAL of the present code .

Within not DATE from the notification of the decision , the ORG and the parties concerned may challenge the decision in ORG that has jurisdiction , which shall make a final ruling in accordance with the procedure laid down in the following Articles .

CARDINAL . Against judgments given by the courts of first instance under LAW before the present PERSON comes into force an appeal shall lie within not more than one year from the date of commencement of this PERSON to ORG that has jurisdiction ...

CARDINAL . Persons acknowledged as owners of expropriated land shall be invited by the Minister of Agriculture ... to lodge a notarially recorded certificate in which they declare that they accept the exchange of land effected under the preceding paragraph and waive any claim for compensation .

CARDINAL . The aforementioned allocation of land belonging to the ORG , to a municipality or to a cooperative shall take effect by decision of the Minister of Agriculture in lieu of a title deed , which shall be entered in the land register .
